channel.title: Have you been hacked multipul times like i have
channel.description:
i have been hacked like 6-7accounts that wher all over lvl 50 and i go to use my recoverys and they dont give me my account back jagex has lost it and are moving on why bother bout da new quests and all new mini games y dont dey fix up there recovery systems
i dont got a keyloger or anythin like dat and i use zone alarm nad avast + my other computer is hoocked up 2 protect dis 1 and is filled wid virus scanners and stuff

item.title: Have you been hacked multipul times like i have
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

[quote=“Inching Away, post:49, topic:20983”][quote author=O M F G link=topic=31906.msg414689#msg414689 date=1162875175]

why would you need a virus scanner if you got a brain?in the past few years i have never used a virus scanner and i have never gotten a virus and i was never hacked on any account.

i did the following things : i started in safe mode and checked all the processes then i went to my normal user and checked the processes that were different and if i see a suspicous process i just search where it was from (or use google to know in wich direcory it is mostly located) and delete it.
so every day i just look at my processes instead of downloading (or buying) virus scanners that slow down your computer(a great example is Norton Anti Virus wich is slow and really slow your computer down)

lol, its a lot easier 2 download the mcafee anti virus and run it every night while u sleep…
[/quote]

Or shutdown the computer ftw?[/quote]

Why oh WHY did you grave dig?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Lele Lele
item.description:
@Lele wrote:

[quote=“Mr.Chris, post:4, topic:20983”][quote author=jimmy0s link=topic=31906.msg375135#msg375135 date=1162233637]

i have been hacked like 6-7accounts that wher all over lvl 50
and i go to use my recoverys and they dont give me my account back
jagex has lost it and are moving on why bother bout da new quests and all
new mini games y dont dey fix up there recovery systems

Corrected your grammar and incorrect spellings. By the way, you spell it multiple.
I have been hacked about 6 or 7 times, on accounts that were all over level 50.
When I use my recoveries, they don’t give me my account back.
Jagex has lost it, and they are moving on.
Why bother about the new quests and mini games?
Why don’t they fix up their recovery systems?
[/quote]

That was a waste of 3 minutes.

Just get a virus scanner, spy bot scanner, or whatever, and keep your password secret.[/quote]Correct lol.

item.title: Have you been hacked multipul times like i have
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Ok, let me clear a few things up.

Everyone knows Windows is bad. It didn’t become bad through pure rumors, it’s facts. I’ll name one, Windows Firewall ONLY blocks incomming traffic.

Personally I’ve had Noron antivirus, it’s a memory hog but I’ve NEVER had a virus on it. My friend has McAfee. He brang his laptop over for a few rounds on Quake 2(I gave him permission to connect to my router) and we went down the shops, came back and he had so much popups he needed to restart. He complained it often crashed and his laptop crashed because of it. My mums friend brought a laptop and it came with Panda Anti-Virus, similar things happend.

The only anti-virus program that I’ve felt safe with is Norton, funnly enough. Right now I’m using NOD32, and seriously prefer NOD32 to Noron.

Read full topic
item.source: Have you been hacked multipul times like i have

item.description:
@blacker wrote:

[quote=“NickMoran06, post:12, topic:20983”][quote author=bullzeye link=topic=31906.msg376071#msg376071 date=1162258657]
Woohoo you’re so funny!
[/quote]
Lmao, I like your Sig. Norton is better than Windows Firewall and McAfee.[/quote] Well everythings better than Windows Firewall. But the crappy part isn that it shuts off Windows Firewall, and I know its crappy, but you could use that extra protection. Plus Norton takes up a crapload of memory (guessing ) and is nearly impossible to delete (just like IE)

SO NORTON SUCKS!

Read full topic
